marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content:
We tend to assess this divestment as positive. From a valuation perspective, the divestment value reflects a fairly premium valuation with a P/BV of 3.2x, significantly above the P/BV valuation of Campina Ice Cream (CAMP) at 1.75x. In terms of P/E, the divestment valuation based on our estimates is around 22-35x, which is above UNVR's overall valuation (15x FY23 P/E and 18.2x annualized 9M24 P/E). From another positive aspect, this divestment can make UNVR more focused on running its business and potentially create room for efficiency, especially considering the company's recent poor performance trend. UNVR may also provide a special dividend from the profit (~4.8 trillion rupiah before tax) from the sale of this business to investors. From a negative aspect, UNVR risks losing a business segment that offers good growth potential going forward. However, we cannot comment further on this due to limited information regarding the track record of the company's ice cream business performance.

marketNews.title: Residential Property Price Survey Results from Bank Indonesia
marketNews.content: The results of the residential property price survey from Bank Indonesia indicate that residential property prices in the primary market in 3Q24 only grew by +1.46% YoY (vs. 2Q24: +1.76% YoY). This result marks the slowest price growth since 4Q21, with slowing price growth occurring across all residential property categories. The slowdown in price growth is caused by increasing construction material costs, licensing issues, high down payments, and taxation. In terms of sales, the survey results indicate that residential property sales in the primary market in 3Q24 decreased by -7.14% YoY (vs. 2Q24: +7.3% YoY), with declines seen in all residential property categories.

marketNews.title: Regulation on Provincial Minimum Wage (UMP) to be Released Soon
marketNews.content: The Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, stated that the regulation regarding the determination of the provincial minimum wage (UMP) will be released by the end of November 2024 or at the latest at the beginning of December 2024.

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister on Resource Management and Nickel Reserves
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that his ministry will be wiser in managing natural resources, including nickel, and mentioned that production growth is no longer the benchmark for the development of the mining industry in Indonesia. Bahlil's statement came just a few days after the CEO of Eramet Indonesia, Jerome Baudelet, stated that Eramet received a 2024 sales quota that was 29% lower compared to forecasts. Baudelet mentioned that the Indonesian government's move was aimed at protecting local miners from declining prices in the global market. On the other hand, Bahlil claimed that based on US Geological Survey data, Indonesia's nickel reserves have increased significantly from 25% of the world's total nickel reserves in 2022-2023 to 42% of the world's total nickel reserves in March-April 2024.

marketNews.title: Donald Trump's Proposed Import Tariffs
marketNews.content: Donald Trump said he would impose 25% import tariffs on Mexico and Canada and an additional 10% import tariff on China on the first day of his term as US president. This move is aimed at forcing these countries to strictly crack down on illegal immigration and drug smuggling into the US. If Trump realizes these tariffs, it will mark an escalation of tensions with the US's three largest trading partners.

marketNews.title: Industry Minister on Apple Investment Proposal
marketNews.content: The Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, stated that the proposal submitted by Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) to invest 100 million US dollars in Indonesia has not met the principle of fairness. Agus's statement suggests that the government is still seeking further negotiations before lifting the sales ban on the iPhone 16 series in Indonesia. Agus mentioned that Apple's proposal is smaller compared to the amount of Apple's investment in other countries. For example, Agus said that Apple has invested more than 244 trillion rupiah for manufacturing facilities in Vietnam, where total sales are only around 1.5 million units. In comparison, Apple only invested around 1.5 trillion rupiah in Indonesia, where the company sold about 2.5 million units.

marketNews.title: Haaretz Report on Israel-Lebanon Ceasefire Framework
marketNews.content: Israeli media, Haaretz, reported that the Israeli cabinet will meet to discuss a ceasefire agreement to temporarily end the conflict with the Lebanese militia, Hezbollah. The proposed ceasefire would last for 60 days and include the withdrawal of Israeli forces from Lebanon and the withdrawal of Hezbollah militia along the Israel-Lebanon border.

tickerNews.title: UNVR Sells Ice Cream Business for IDR 7 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) announced that it signed an agreement to sell its ice cream business on November 22, 2024, to PT Magnum Ice Cream Indonesia for a value of 7 trillion rupiah (excluding VAT). The transaction value includes: The fair market value of fixed assets totaling 2.55 trillion rupiah. The net book value as of September 2024 totaling 1.99 trillion rupiah. The inventory value as of September 2024 totaling 172.8 billion rupiah. On the agreement signing date, the buyer had an affiliation relationship with the company because the ultimate parent company for both was Unilever plc. However, at the time of execution and settlement of the transaction, the buyer no longer has an affiliation relationship with the company. According to UNVR, this divestment of the ice cream business is part of the Unilever group's plan to separate its global ice cream business. The sale allows UNVR to realize the value of its investment in the Indonesian ice cream business and return that value to its shareholders in the short term, as well as refocus on its remaining core businesses to enhance shareholder value in the long term. This sale agreement is the realization of the plan that UNVR management hinted at mid-year. This transaction plan will be discussed at the General Meeting of Shareholders (GMS) and the Independent GMS, although the dates have not yet been announced. Further details regarding the transaction will be outlined concurrently with the announcement of the GMS and Independent GMS.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Studies Gold Mine Acquisition; Boosting Nickel and Bauxite Exploration
tickerNews.content: ANTM: The General Manager of Geomin Unit Aneka Tambang, Abdul Bari, stated that the company is studying opportunities for gold mine acquisitions domestically and internationally. Additionally, Abdul also mentioned that ANTM will increase nickel, gold, and bauxite exploration activities over the next 5 years with an exploration budget of 723 million US dollars or 11.2 trillion rupiah until 2029. The increase in ANTM's exploration activities is driven by MIND ID's demand for the company to increase its National Resources Ownership (NRO) to the range of 15-20% for nickel, gold, and bauxite reserves. For comparison, ANTM currently only holds an NRO for gold of 0.2% of national potential resources, while the NRO for nickel and bauxite is 10% and 4% respectively.

tickerNews.title: IPCC to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2024 FY
tickerNews.content: Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal (IPCC) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 44.4 billion rupiah or 24.4 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is December 3, 2024, with payment on December 23, 2024. Referring to the IPCC share price closing on the regular market on Tuesday (26/11) at 750 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 3.3%.

tickerNews.title: NICL to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2024 FY
tickerNews.content: PAM Mineral (NICL) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 95.7 billion rupiah or 9 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is December 5, 2024, with payment on December 16, 2024. Referring to the NICL share price closing on Tuesday (26/11) at 306 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 2.9%.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Records New Contracts Worth ~IDR 17 Trillion in 10M24
tickerNews.content: Wijaya Karya (WIKA) recorded new contract value of approximately 17 trillion rupiah (-24% YoY) during 10M24, equivalent to 46% of the 2024 target of 37 trillion rupiah. Of this new contract value, 39.75% came from the infrastructure and building segment, followed by industry (32.84%), realty and property (14.18%), and energy and industrial plant (13.22%). Based on the source, private sector contributed 44.21% of the total new contract value, followed by the government (31.44%), State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) (23.92%), and investment (0.43%).

tickerNews.title: Sarana Mitra Luas (SMIL) Director Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder and President Director of Sarana Mitra Luas, Hadi Suhermin, purchased 27 million SMIL shares at a price of 185 rupiah per share on November 22, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 5 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Hadi Suhermin's ownership in SMIL increased from 49% to 49.3%.

tickerNews.title: Makmur Berkah Amanda (AMAN) KEK Halal Industrial Park Attracts Investment
tickerNews.content: Makmur Berkah Amanda (AMAN) announced that the Sidoarjo Halal Industrial Park Special Economic Zone (KEK), managed by the company, has secured an investment of 50 billion rupiah from cargo storage company, Super Dry Marine. AMAN Director, Adi Teja Surya, stated that they are targeting the Sidoarjo Halal Industrial Park KEK to attract investments worth 97.8 trillion rupiah by 2045.

tickerNews.title: WSKT Needs Bond Restructuring to Lift Trading Suspension
tickerNews.content: The Finance Director of Waskita Karya (WSKT), Wiwi Suprihatno, stated that the company will strive to obtain approval for the restructuring of the Sustainable Bonds III Phase IV Year 2019 Series B so that the company's shares can be lifted from the trading suspension imposed by the IDX since May 8, 2023. The bond with a principal value of 1.36 trillion rupiah is the only unsecured bond that WSKT has not yet been able to restructure due to obstacles in obtaining approval from the largest bondholders in that series. WSKT will hold another bondholder meeting (RUPO) on December 12, 2024, to request approval for the bond restructuring.

tickerNews.title: Bank Jago Director to Resign, Board Changes to be Discussed in EGM
tickerNews.content: Bank Jago (ARTO) announced that Peterjan van Nieuwenhuizen submitted his letter of resignation from his position as a director of the company, effective December 31, 2024. This plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) on December 17, 2024. The EGMS will also discuss the resignation plan of Teguh Dartanto from the position of independent commissioner and the appointment of Mahdi Syahbuddin as an independent commissioner.
